author: A_Brickset_user
title: 3 shades of perple?
review:
Yes, this is one great set, lots of good pieces. There are 2 bad things i could come up with. 
1 the back door is a 2 tall and 3 long door, quit rare but does not come with another one if you wanted tobuild a car.
2 the perple color is in 3 shades if you look at it closely.
Overall it is a great set it may not be a "must buy" but it is close.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Brilliant
review: I too bought this from Argos at $19.99 on March 9, anyway, this is a great set!!! I have it and it is ace. There are new flesh toned figures which are pretty cool. The Grim though, I thought was gonna be bigger but... The door on the back is pretty cool to let your minifigs on and off instead of having to pull off all the decks. The sliding beds is a nice feature. You can also take off the roof and decks to see inside while the bus moves! (not by itself, of course lol)

author: A_Brickset_user
title: WOOWIE!!!!!
review: i have it. it has Sirius as a dog ,Stan the driverand Harry Potter. It has three beds with pillows, a back door, a dark-grey lanturnpole wich is new in that color, the trunk of Harry is a bit more cherrywood (more red i mean) and it has 2 knight bus signs. But the smal windows does not has glass in it but that's ok.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: good stuff!
review:
overall a very good set with plenty of useful pieces and of course its in the new purple colour.

PROS:useful purple pieces, could easily make 3 purple buses/hippy vans/gang vehicles. if you swop the minifigs' hands for yellow ones they could be put to good use. pillows could come in useful as would the dog.

CONS:annoying incompatable skin tones! (in my set a piece was missing0
      Overall a great set!  recommendable to any children or lego inthusiasts   :}

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Hello.
review:
This set could have done better with:

A latter to get up and downstairs.
Ernie.
Could have been longer, so on each level you could fit 3 beds.
A luugage compartment.

This set is very cool set.

author: sethlee
title: good enough
review: I like this set beacause there is enogh sets and beacomes with 1 owl and 1 dog even it could fit over 2 people its big enough like an bus but i wish it have more chararcters and suplies so it will be an complete set.

author: Tri_pod_king
title: ''Welcome to the Knight Bus, transportation for the stranded witch or wizard.''
review: I don't care what it is, this set is AWESOME! You get a load of purple pieces, it's very sturdy, and great for play and display purposes, but especially good for play purposes. Includes detailed figures, and my favorite Harry Potter minifig I have ever gotten. Although I would've added a place for Harry's trunk and Hedwig. I would've made a cage for Hedwig. Well, now that I think about it, there was some room for the trunk and possibly Hedwig. This set is also quite movie accurate and I hope that Lego makes more double(or, in this case, triple) decker buses in the future.

author: LegoAdventures
title: Knight Bus
review:
What a Stupendous set!. This is a Wonderful remake of the Purple Knight Bus from Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, and I have to say Lego really did this set Justice because it looks Fantastic.
Released in 2004 to Coincide with the Blockbuster release of Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, it contains 242 Pieces, 2 Mini-figures, The Knight Bus, The Grim and a few elements resembling the Street. I managed to get this set from Bricklink.com in a New Sealed Box in Excellent Condition for $80 AUD, and i can strongly say do not surpass the opportunity to get this set.

Box/Contents/Instructions:


The Box is 28.5cm Long, 28.5cm Tall and 7cm Thick. It consists of the Usual offerings and features found on a Box like the front Illustration of the Knight Bus and the Red Lego Insignia. Around the sides, back and small part of the front of the Box is covered in the colour Blue. On the back of the Box there is an Illustration of all the Prisoner of Azkaban sets (Apart from the Exclusive 10132 Motorized Hogwarts Express), however they are all Trans-White and see through. The only see that isn't see through is the Knight Bus and it is in colour. This is a feature found on all the Prisoner of Azkaban sets. There is an Alternative Model of the set which you can download from LEGO.com, however I don't think the Link is there anymore. There is also numerous images off other angles of the set. And then there is the Future References, Trademarks, Licensed Agreements, Trademarks and where the Components are made, for this particular set the Components are made in Denmark and the Czech Republic (Pronounced Check Republic if you didn't already know hehe) That's what I love about Lego is that it's Quality European Manufactured.
  Inside the Box there is 3 Plastic Bags numbered 1-3, so the Building Experience will be much easier, and more organized considering the pieces you need for that particular step is in the appropriate bag. There is also the 33 Page Instruction Booklet, 40 if you include the Illustrations at the back.

Mini-figs:


Stanley Shunpike more commonly known as Stan Shunpike the Knight Bus conductor: Stan features a Purple Conductor Hat, Simple, Calm Black Sparkling eyes. He also features slightly raised Black eyebrows and a funny sort of smiling mouth. He also has Orange Hair coming down both sides of his face. His Torso is very detailed. It features a Purple Conductor Uniform Jacket which is slightly opened an has a White work T-Shirt underneath with a small white Collar and a Purple Tie. He has a large Black outlined Collar on his Conductor Jacket which features 2 Sliver Buttons at the very end of the Collar. He has 1 Red line on both sides of his Conductor Jacket. On one side of the Left side of the Jacket he has a large White Oval resembling some sort of Badge. On both sides of the Jacket he also has 2 Diagonal Red lines resembling pockets. He also has a Black Rope going down his Jacket that stops at a Silver Square with a Circle in the middle that has 5 Circles in it, and a Black Wind-up handle on the side of it which all resembles the Ticket Machine which I though was incredible detail. His right side of his Conductor Jacket is a bit messy almost like he always has to open that side up so he can use the Ticket Mechanism or to get things out of his Jacket from that side.

Harry James Potter: Harry features his usual Messy Black Hair, Sparkling Brave Black eyes, Red Scar and Circular Glasses with Simple smile. His Torso features features a Opened Blue Jacket with an opened Collar and Pockets on either side. Underneath his Jacket he features a Grey Sweater type Shirt and last but not least Beige pants. Harry is also holding a Black Wand with a Trans-Neon Yellowish Green Cone on the end, resembling the Spell Lumos!

Privet Drive Street:


This set features some Street elements from Privet Drive. There is a Green Spiky plant Shrub, A Street Light Pole which is made up of a Dark Grey Custom Lamp Pole piece, a Trans-Neon Yellow Cylindrical Piece and a Dark Grey Inverted Dish on top. There is also a Brown Trunk (Treasure Chest) that has a Dark Grey package with lacing around it on a Beige Tile and Harry's White Owl Hedwig. And last of all Sirius Black as The Grim which is a Grey Dog piece.

Knight Bus:


You start of by Building the bottom of the Bus which is numerous Black Sloped pieces and Purple pieces. You then place 2 Large White Tile pieces at the back of the Bus which resembling some sort of floor. You then start by placing numerous Purple pieces and a Window and moveable door at the back which becomes the back entrance, for Harry to place his Trunk. You then start by building the front of the Bus, which is numerous Black slopes and various arches. You then place 2 Windows on either side of the back of the Bus and then you push 2 clear inner window pieces in the middle so it becomes a realistic glass window. Then you place a formation of small purple Square pieces and 2 more windows next to that formation. You then place a Custom front piece of the Bus that has 2 Clear lights attached to it and numerous slopes to resemble the Bonet. You also place a Steering Wheel and a Light Grey Chair for the Driver, who is actually supposed to be Ernie Prang. You then place the Front Windscreen of the Bus which has the Jamaican Shrunken Head Printed in the top of the Windscreen. You then Build numerous Black Tile pieces so the Second part of the Bus can be attached on and off. You then place 2 Light Grey Axles and 2 Large Black wheels with 4 Large Purple inner Wheel pieces. You also place a Red piece with 2 White Round Dish pieces on the bottom so it can rock around and slide everywhere like the real beds in the movie. You also place a White Sloped piece with a printed Orange Pillowcase on it. You then build the second level which is a formation of numerous Purple and Glass window pieces (That are repeated throughout the entire set) with a large Windscreen at the front and a Printed Black sign with the words Knight Bus writing in White on it. You also place another Red Bed piece which is identical to the one you placed on the bottom level, it too can slide around like the beds in the real movie. You then place numerous Black Tile pieces for the Third floor. You build once again numerous Purple and Glass window pieces with a Windscreen on the front, and you place again another Red Bed piece. Last of all you place numerous Black Tile pieces for the Roof. The Roof has an attachment at the back for another Black Knight Bus sign writing in White, and numerous Purple sloped Roof pieces.

Overall:


Overall this is a Wonderful set. It is enthralled with Realistic features and elements that make this set Unique and Rare. It is an Exquisite set that will keep your imagination going for Hours upon Hours. I strongly recommend this set with full Confidence that you will like it, a complete Triumph! 5/5

Thank you so much for taking the time to read my review :)

author: United_Bricks
title: Purple pieces
review:
I got this on ebay for a pretty good price, when I got It I was most happy. You get two mini figures, Harry potter and the conductor(rare mini figures).The purple pieces are extremely rare and so is the grey dog. You get a treasure chest with a tile in it, on the tile was a picture of a bag (cool design). There is also a grey lamp and a white owl.

Pros-
Purple pieces
Grey dog
Chest
Owl
Tile
Mini figures

Cons-
There could of been the bus driver mini figure like in the movie.

Overall-
Nice set 9/10
